answerText: A Tale of a Tub[10] This other satirical work by Swift presents a solution for easing poverty and improving marital relations in Ireland: eating one-year-old babies.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 5 | 3 | Literature | British | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: This work contains copious amounts of commentary and digression to satirize scholarship. For 10 points each: [10] Name this work of Jonathan Swift in which Peter, Martin, and Jack represent sects of Christianity that also satirizes hack writing and other aspects of the author's contemporary life.
